intro: Microlicia nervosa, commonly known as the narrow-veined microlicia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are typically pale pink or white, with five petals and stamen, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Microlicia nervosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
